entries: 当你使用6级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，球体的半径将每超过5级的法术位等级增加10英尺。如果使用的法术位是7级或更高级别，则伤害掷骰将从d6变为d10。

spell.name: Quillfire
entries: 你的前臂上长出有毒的刺。你可以在近战中使用这些刺，对敌人造成{@damage 1d8}穿刺伤害和{@damage 1d8}毒素伤害，再加上你的力量调整值。

你也可以向距离{@footnote 30 feet|Converter's note: The original text mentions \"range\" here but what that range meant was included in the Range field of the spell as \"Self (30 foot), which is incompatible with 5eTools.}以内的任何目标发射刺针。在成功的远程攻击中，它们会造成{@damage 1d8}点穿刺伤害和{@damage 1d8}点毒素伤害，再加上你的敏捷修正。

spell.name: Quivaelyn's Silversteel Veil
entries: 一道薄薄的银色雾气形成了一道魔法结界，看起来像是寒冷清晨呼出的暖气一样虚无缥缈。这道结界能够抵挡敌人的攻击。在你的下一个回合结束前，你和距离你5英尺以内的任何盟友对所有敌人都拥有半掩体，而所有用来察觉你或盟友的感知检定都会被迫以劣势骰{@skill Perception}。

spell.name: Quivaelyn's Sharpening Palm
entries: 你沿着刀刃滑过手掌，手中的魔法使其拥有超乎寻常的锋利。触摸一把斩击近战武器。在持续时间内，使用该武器进行攻击时，19或20点都会造成暴击。一旦该武器造成暴击，咒语就会结束。如果武器在咒语持续时间内未造成暴击，咒语将无效并结束。
法术结束后，武器保持锋利状态，持续24小时，就像一位熟练的剑术大师用磨刀石磨过一样。

spell.name: Quivaelyn's Sloth Strike
entries: 作为施放此法术的一部分，你必须使用武器进行一次近战攻击，攻击范围内的一名生物，否则法术失败。命中后，目标受到攻击的正常效果，并额外受到{@damage 1d10}点冰冷伤害，因为它的血液变成了沉重的冰块，它的四肢变得沉重。直到你的下一个回合结束前，目标的移动速度减半，AC和敏捷豁免承受-2惩罚，并且无法使用反应。在目标的下一个回合，它只能使用行动或奖励行动中的一个，而不能两者都使用。无论生物的能力或魔法物品如何，它在自己的回合内只能进行一次近战或远程{@action Attack}攻击。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用3级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，攻击造成的初始额外伤害会每超过2级的法术位等级增加{@dice 1d10}。

spell.name: Quivaelyn's Wind Stepping Stance
entries: 一系列精确而寂静的手势使你进入一种状态，在这种状态下，你可以奔跑在任何有实质的东西上，即使通常无法承受你的重量：一团尘土、飘落的雪花、细小的树枝、微风中的樱花等等。在持续时间内，你获得一个等同于你行走速度的攀爬速度，并且你可以垂直攀爬、倾斜攀爬或水平移动，通过任何未被占据的空间，只要该空间内有比空气更实质的东西，并且不超过离你能站立的表面40英尺高。如果你处于{@condition incapacitated}、{@condition restrained}或其他无法移动的状态，法术会提前结束。

spell.name: Radiant Assault
entries: 你在范围内的一个点中心引发了一股半径为20英尺的辐射能量爆炸。任何被困在爆炸中的生物会受到{@damage 12d6}点辐射伤害，或者在成功的敏捷豁免扑克牌上受到一半伤害。
此外，受到爆炸影响的生物必须进行一次体质豁免才能避免在其下一个回合结束前变为{@condition stunned}。
被致盲或无法看见的生物不受这个法术影响。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用8级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，每超过7级的位级，辐射伤害增加{@dice 1d6}。

spell.name: Rage Beacon
entries: 选择范围内的一个点。每个在该点周围10英尺范围内的生物都必须进行一次感知豁免投。那些失败的生物会充满强烈的杀意，他们会尽快朝你移动，尽管他们不会移动到明显危险的区域。如果生物无法接近你，那个生物的法术效果就会结束。
受此法术影响的生物将使用{@action Dash}动作靠近你，并一旦进入近战范围，将用所有攻击目标你。这些生物不会执行其他动作。受到该法术影响的生物对你的所有近战攻击都具有优势。(spell)。

spell.name: Rain of Blood
entries: 天空变暗，血雨倾盆而下。在你选择的范围内，以你选择的点为中心，半径10英尺，高30英尺的圆柱内的生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。未通过豁免的生物会受到{@damage 8d6}毒素伤害，通过豁免的生物则只受到一半伤害。圆柱下的地面变成一片黏糊糊的泥潭，土地和石头溶解。施法后的10分钟内，圆柱覆盖的区域变成艰难地形。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 你可以使用5级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术。每超过4级的法术等级，你可以将圆柱体的半径增加10英尺，或者伤害增加{@dice 1d6}。

spell.name: Rain of Steel

time.condition: which you take when a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of you

entries: 你进入一种神秘的战斗意识的恍惚状态，感知敌人的接近，并保护性地挥动你的武器，以超自然的速度打击它们。当你施放这个法术时，直到你的下一个回合开始时，当一个生物在你的5英尺范围内开始它的回合时，它会受到{@damage 1d8}的力量伤害。
在这个咒语持续期间，每当一个生物在你的5英尺范围内结束其回合时，你可以使用你的反应来重新激活这个效果，导致触发生物和任何其他敌对生物在你的下一个回合开始之前在你的5英尺范围内受到{@damage 1d8}力量伤害。

spell.name: Rainbow Beam
entries: {@homebrew {@note This spell is not found in either the spell lists nor the index; only within the spell descriptions. As such, to which classes' spell list it belongs is unknown}}
一道彩虹色的光束从你的手中射出。进行远程法术攻击。命中目标时，目标受到伤害，伤害值为{@dice 2d12} + 你的法术属性调整值，并且在其下一个回合结束前处于{@condition stunned}状态。成功的体质豁免才能免疫眩晕效果。
所造成的伤害类型将从以下表格中随机确定：

rows: 再投两次骰子，如果再次投到这个结果则忽略。

entries: 如果结果显示光束是多色的，那么目标会受到每种两种伤害类型 {@dice 2d12} 点伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用4级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，所造成的该类型伤害增加{@dice 1d12}，每超过2级的两个法术位级别增加一次。

spell.name: Rainbow Blast

m.text: a small clear gem or crystal prism worth at least 50 gp

entries: 一道多彩的能量射线从你的手中射向射程内的目标。进行远程法术攻击。命中后，射线对目标造成{@damage 1d8}酸性伤害，{@damage 1d8}冰冷伤害，{@damage 1d8}火焰伤害，{@damage 1d8}闪电伤害和{@damage 1d8}雷霆伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，每种伤害类型的伤害量会在第3级以上的每三个位级别上增加{@dice 1d8}。

spell.name: Random Casualty

time.condition: which you take after you or an ally has been struck by an enemy

entries: 当一个敌人袭击你的盟友时，你做出手势，你的盟友毫发无伤，但是你的一个敌人却像被击中一样抽搐。当范围内的一个敌人袭击你的盟友，但在他们掷骰子确定伤害之前，你可以使用你的反应来迫使他们进行一次感知豁免。如果他们失败，伤害将应用于他们的一个盟友身上。随机确定哪个盟友。该盟友必须在目标范围内30英尺之内。如果目标没有盟友，法术失败。

spell.name: Rary's Mnemonic Enhancer

components.m: a piece of string, black dragon blood, and squid ink

entries: 你每天只能施放这个法术一次，在开始准备当天的法术之前。从任何其他职业的法术列表中选择最多三个法术等级（三个一级法术，一个一级法术和一个二级法术，或一个三级法术）。在接下来的24小时内，你将这些选择的法术视为属于你职业的法术列表，并可以正常准备这些法术。

spell.name: Rary's Superior Spell Enhancer
entries: 一旦你施放这个法术，你将保留它的能量，以增强之后你将施放的另一个法术。在法术结束前的某个时刻，你可以选择在一个法术攻击检定中给予自己优势，或者对一个目标对你施放的法术的豁免检定施加劣势。
此外，如果你用上述效果之一增强的法术造成伤害，你可以重新投掷任何掷出1的伤害骰。你必须使用第二次投掷的结果，即使伤害更低也是如此。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用7级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，当重新投掷你增强的法术的伤害骰时，你可以重新投掷任何掷出1或2的伤害骰。

spell.name: Ray of Entropy
entries: 你从伸出的手中发射出一道负能量射线，瞄准射程内的目标。对目标进行远程法术攻击。如果攻击命中，生物在法术持续时间内在力量、敏捷和体质豁免检定和能力检定上获得劣势。
受影响的生物可以在每个回合结束时尝试进行一次魅力豁免检定，若成功则法术结束。

spell.name: Ray of Exhaustion
entries: 你用一束虚弱的黑光打击一个你能看见且在射程内的生物。该生物必须进行一次体质豁免才能避免受到 {@condition exhaustion} 的虚弱等级影响。如果生物的豁免值比豁免 DC 低 5 点或更多，它将受到两个等级的 {@condition exhaustion} 影响。如果豁免成功，生物不受影响。

spell.name: Ray of Ondovir
entries: 对范围内的生物进行远程法术攻击。如果命中，生物必须重复上一回合的移动动作。例如，如果生物在上一次移动动作中向前移动了15英尺，然后向右移动了15英尺，那么它将立即向前移动15英尺，然后向右移动15英尺。生物不会移动到危险或致命的区域。如果生物被迫进入这些区域，法术将结束。

spell.name: Ray of Reprisal

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 30 feet of you hits one of your allies with an attack roll

entries: {@homebrew {@note Converter's note: This spell is not listed in the class spell lists, so it does not have any classes listed.}}
你向敌人发射一道烈焰光束，迫使其感受到对你同伴造成的伤害。对攻击者进行远程法术攻击。如果攻击命中，对目标造成{@damage 4d6}辐射伤害。

spell.name: Razorscales
entries: 你的皮肤变成锋利的鳞片。你的护甲等级不能低于15，无论你穿戴什么盔甲。此外，在持续时间内，任何试图拼搏你或对你进行近战攻击的生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免投骰。未通过豁免的生物会受到{@damage 2d4}的割伤伤害，通过者则只受一半伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用3级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，伤害会每超过2级增加{@dice 1d4}。

spell.name: Read Moods
entries: 选择你能看到范围内的最多六个生物。这些生物必须进行一次感知豁免投。如果它们成功，那个生物不受法术影响。如果它们失败，DM必须为你提供每个生物情绪状态的一个词汇总，比如"快乐"，"困惑"，"害怕"，或"暴力"。你从这个法术中得不到关于非生物（如构造物或不死生物）或对精神伤害免疫的生物的信息。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用2级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，你可以读取情绪的生物数量会随着每个超过1级的法术位等级增加两个。

spell.name: Read Object
entries: 你可以集中精力在你正在触摸的物体上，阅读最近事件留下的心灵印记。在你施放这个法术的时间结束时，你将了解到在物体周围30英尺范围内发生的过去24小时内的任何事件。你将从物体的视角看到、听到和闻到那些事件，就好像你当时就在那里一样。

你还会看到最后一个接触过这个物品的生物的心理影像，而且是从这个物品的视角看到的，无论这个物品上次被持有是多久以前。你只会收到有关那个生物的一些信息，比如它当时的外貌（包括大小的感觉）、它是否独自一人（尽管你看不到可能在场的其他生物），以及DM描述那个生物在上次触摸这个物品时的情绪状态的一个或两个词（比如"愤怒"，"极度焦虑"，"放松"，"满足"，"完全没有情绪"，等等）。如果那个生物无法感受情绪，或者它的心理状态对你来说太过陌生以至于无法理解，DM会告诉你这一点。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用7级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，如果这个物体在过去一周内被多个生物处理过，你将获得关于每个处理过它的生物的相同信息，就像你通常会获得关于最后一个处理过它的生物的信息一样。

spell.name: Reality Maelstrom

components.m: a golden hoop no less than 1 inch across

entries: 一道闪电和雷声响起，一个半径为20英尺的球形时空裂缝出现，中心点由你选择在射程内。球形范围内所有重量不超过100磅的松散物品都会被吸入漩涡中心，并传送到随机的存在平面。同样，任何被困在球形范围内的生物必须进行一次感知豁免检定，否则将被拉入漩涡并传送。所有被吸入漩涡的物体和生物都会被传送到同一个存在平面。
漩涡有一个次要的风暴效应，从球体中心延伸40英尺。在扩展区域内的所有重量不超过50磅的未被看管的物体会被拉近20英尺到漩涡中心，然后被吸入裂缝并传送。在扩展区域内的生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免检定。未通过检定的生物会被拉近20英尺到球体中心。任何被拉入球体的生物必须进行一次感知豁免检定，未通过检定的生物会被传送到另一个位面。
每次施放此法术时，根据以下表格进行投掷，以确定被传送到另一个位面的物体或生物的目的地。

rows: 监狱深渊 (Tarterian Depths) 的卡塞里 (Carceri)
无尽深渊层(%(Infinite Layers of Abyss)%)
英雄领域的阿斯加德(Heroic Domains of Asgard)
地狱的荒凉永恒 (Bleak Eternity of Gehenna)
九层地狱（Nine Hells of Baator）
阿切隆地狱战场 (Infernal Battlefield of Acheron)
机械宇宙( Clockwork Nirvana of Mechanus)
野兽领域 (Wilderness of the Beastlands)
奥林匹亚仙境（Olympian Glades of Arborea）
异域和谐领域 (Concordant Domain of Outlands)
元素位面 (Elemental Plane) 的土 (of Earth)
空气元素位面 (Elemental Plane of Air)
水元素位面 (Elemental Plane of Water)
巴罗维亚或DM选择的其他半位面

spell.name: Reaver's Touch
entries: 你的手触摸会吸取目标的生命能量，让你能够牺牲动物或者有时其他生物，将它们的活力转化为你自己的。对范围内的有意识的生物进行一次近战法术攻击。如果目标是野兽，则你有优势。命中后，目标受到{@damage 1d6}点死灵伤害，你获得临时生命值，数值等同于造成伤害的一半（向上取整）。当你达到5级（{@dice 2d6}）、11级（{@dice 3d6}）和17级（{@dice 4d6}）时，法术伤害增加{@dice 1d6}。

spell.name: Recitation

components.m: a sacred text of your faith

entries: 通过背诵圣典或神圣教义中的神圣宣言，你可以为盟友祈求远古神圣的祝福。选择范围内最多四个生物，其中一个可以是你自己。在法术结束前，每当目标进行攻击检定或豁免检定时，目标可以投掷一个{@dice d4}，并将投掷的数字加到攻击检定或豁免检定中。
如果目标崇拜与你相同的守护神，它可以选择为此法术的效果投掷一个{@dice d6}，而不是一个{@dice d4}。
无论你是否选择自己作为这个法术的目标，你在持续时间内都会获得+2的盔甲等级奖励。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用5级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，你可以额外选择每个高于4级的法术位等级的一个生物作为目标。

spell.name: Redirect Spell
entries: 你在自己和一个盟友之间创造了一种神奇的联系，使得任何可能伤害到盟友的法术都会转向你。在施放这个法术时，触摸一个愿意的生物。每当你与那个生物在15英尺范围内时，它被迫对抗一个法术的豁免，或被一个法术攻击所瞄准时，法术会转而瞄准你。如果法术强迫进行豁免，你将进行自己的豁免检定，并根据成功或失败承受其效果。如果法术是一个攻击，攻击检定会对准你。
如果所选择的生物离你超过一英里，这个法术会提前结束。

spell.name: Reflect Elements

time.condition: taken when you would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

entries: 这个法术部分地重定向了影响你的元素能量，将其中一部分反击到它的来源。进行一次近战或远程法术攻击（由你选择），瞄准触发伤害的来源。命中时，目标受到等于其刚刚造成伤害一半的力量伤害。无论你是否命中，你都会对触发伤害类型获得抗性（包括对抗触发伤害），直到你的下一个回合开始。

spell.name: Refuge Talisman

m.text: a specially prepared breakable object worth at least 1,500 gp

entries: 你赋予一个特制的物品强大的魔法。生物可以在打破物品的同时说出命令词，并立即被传送到你在施法时指定的位置。目的地必须与打破物品时的存在平面相同，否则法术失败。

spell.name: Regal Procession
entries: 这个法术的效果类似于寻找坐骑，除了你召唤出三匹额外的坐骑，它们配备了嚼环和马笼头、骑乘鞍、鞍毯、丝带和装饰品，以及一面华丽的旗帜。你可以选择马匹和制服的颜色，其中可以包括纹章或个人标志。

spell.name: Rejuvenate Self
entries: 在这个法术持续期间，每当你的回合开始时，如果自上一回合开始以来，你进行了一次或多次近战攻击，且每次攻击造成至少10点伤害，你将因你造成的最大伤害攻击所造成的每5点伤害而获得1点临时生命值。你在一回合内通过这种方式获得的临时生命值的最大数量等同于你的法术属性调整值。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用2级或更高级法术槽施放此法术时，你将法术持续时间增加至10分钟。如果你使用3级或更高级法术槽，持续时间增加至1小时。此外，在一回合内你从此法术获得的临时生命值上限最大值等于你的施法能力调整值或你用来施放此法术的法术槽等级，以较高者为准。

spell.name: Remote Viewing
entries: 你脑海中出现了一个形象，展示了如果你站在一定距离外会看到的景象。选择范围内的一个点，你可以看到那个点。直到你的下一个回合结束前，你从那个点视觉感知，而不是实际所在位置。你也从那个点确定视线。

spell.name: Revenance
entries: 你触摸的不死生物被赋予了对神灵的小小干涉的防护。被赋予防护的不死生物会忽略下一次敌人试图驱散它的尝试。

spell.name: Reverse Arrows
entries: 在一定时间内，对你进行的非魔法射击攻击有劣势。如果一枚飞箭因此劣势而未命中你，那么这枚飞箭将被反弹至攻击者。如果这种情况发生，你可以使用你的反应对攻击者进行远程法术攻击。命中时，目标受到正常的飞箭伤害。
此外，你在持续时间内对非魔法飞弹的伤害具有抗性。

spell.name: Reverse Teleport

time.condition: which you take at the end of any turn during which a creature within range teleported or left the plane you are in for another

entries: 触发生物必须进行一次感知豁免投骰。如果未能通过，传送或者平面旅行将被逆转，目标重新出现在它以这种方式旅行前所占据的空间中。

spell.name: Righteous Might
entries: 当你充满神圣力量时，你变得巨大。在持续时间内，你的体型增加一个等级（例如从中等变为大型），并且在力量和体质检定和豁免 throws 上获得优势。此外，你的皮肤变硬，使你的AC获得+4的加值，并且你对死灵伤害具有抗性。
任何你携带或穿戴的装备也会增长。你的近战武器的攻击距离增加5英尺，使用它们造成的伤害额外增加+2。你的远程武器造成的伤害也额外增加+2，但它们的射程不变。
施放此法术后，如果在完成短暂休息或长休息之前再次施放它，你必须以劣势进行一次体质豁免检定，豁免 DC 为你自己的施法 DC 加上自上次完成短暂休息或长休息以来施放此法术的次数。如果未通过检定，你会晕眩 {@condition unconscious} 1分钟，法术失败。

spell.name: Rip Creature

m.text: two black gloves worth at least 20 gp

entries: 你指向你能看到的尺寸为大型或更小的生物。该生物必须进行一次体质豁免才能避免受到{@damage 2d10}的斩击伤害，仿佛它开始被撕裂一样。在豁免成功时，目标会受到一半的伤害。在施法持续期间的每个回合，你可以使用一个额外动作来迫使该生物再次进行豁免并承受伤害。
如果一个生物被这个法术降为0点生命值，它会被撕成两半而死亡。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级或更高级的法术位施放这个法术时，伤害会每超过5级的两个位级增加{@dice 1d10}。

spell.name: Ripen
entries: 在施放这个法术时，你触摸一株未成熟的植物。该植物会变成其种类的成熟个体。如果这株植物是结果实的品种，那么它将结满成熟的果实。你可以摘 {@dice 1d4 + 1} 个果实。果实在接下来的24小时内保持成熟和有营养，然后会腐烂。当生物在短休息期间食用一个或多个仍然成熟的果实时，如果在休息结束时通过消耗生命骰来恢复生命值，它将额外恢复等于你的法术属性调整值的生命值。如果生物在休息期间还接受了任何魔法治疗，那么它从这个法术中获得的额外生命值恢复量将翻倍。

spell.name: Rune of Peace
entries: 作为施放这个法术的一部分，你必须对射程内的目标进行一次近战武器攻击或徒手攻击，否则法术失败。命中时，你的攻击额外造成{@damage 1d6}点辐射伤害，并且目标必须进行一次感知豁免投掷。如果未通过，目标在其下一个回合结束之前无法对你进行任何攻击投掷。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 你可以使用2级或更高级的法术位施放这个法术，每超过1级的法术等级，增加{@dice 1d6}的辐射伤害。

spell.name: Ruthless Assault
entries: 你笼罩在一层强大的光环中，赋予你力量并加快盟友的攻击速度。直到你的下一个回合结束，每当你进行一次攻击检定时，你可以投掷{@dice 1d8}，并将投掷的数字加到你的攻击检定中。如果攻击命中，你也将同样的数字加到所造成的伤害中。在相同的持续时间内，你每个回合额外获得一个行动。这个行动可以用来执行以下任一行动之一：{@action Attack}(仅限一次武器攻击)、{@action Dash}、脱离战斗、{@action Hide}或{@action Use an Object}。你选择的任何生物，在它们的下一个回合开始时，如果距离你不超过10英尺，也会获得相同的额外行动。

spell.name: Sacred Strike

components.m: two drops of unholy water, and one of the caster's hairs

entries: 你召唤一条柔韧的力量线，从你的手中散发出紫色火花。你被视为精通这种武器，像普通的近战武器一样挥舞它，当使用它进行攻击和伤害骰时，你可以用你的法术能力修正值代替力量修正值。它的攻击范围为10英尺。
任何被这武器击中的生物都会遭受极度痛苦，并受到等于{@dice 4d4} + 你的法术属性调整值的死灵伤害。被这鞭子击中的生物必须进行一次体质豁免才能。如果未通过，它在下一个回合结束前的下一个攻击骰、能力检定或豁免检定中都会受到劣势。造成伤害后，施法者会回复等于造成的死灵伤害一半的生命值。
被这把武器击中的不死生物会受到正常伤害，但不会遭受任何其他影响。此外，与其被治愈，当你用这个法术伤害一个不死生物时，你会受到等同于造成的死灵伤害一半的伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，每超过4级的两个位级，死灵伤害增加{@dice 1d4}。

spell.name: Saga of Foretold Doom
entries: 当你发动攻击时，你呼唤出一个古老的预言，似乎早已预言了你对手的失败。作为施放此法术的一部分，对范围内的一只生物进行远程武器攻击。你可以使用你的法术属性代替敏捷属性进行此次攻击和伤害骰投掷。如果攻击命中，它会造成额外 {@damage 2d12} 的精神伤害，并且在法术持续时间内对目标的所有攻击骰投掷都具有优势。
在目标的每个回合结束前，目标必须进行一次感知豁免投。如果失败，它会受到{@damage 6d12}点心灵伤害，并且在接下来的回合结束前，它会成为你的{@condition frightened}。如果豁免成功，法术结束。
如果在持续时间结束之前再次施放该法术，该法术将立即结束。

spell.name: Salutary Touch
entries: 你的触摸使目标在本法术持续期间获得在体质豁免投掷中躲避{@condition exhaustion}的优势。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用2级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，持续时间增加1小时，或每个高于1级的法术位级别。

spell.name: Sand Blade

m.text: a hilt worth at least 500 gp and a pound of sand

entries: 你将一堆沙子变成了一把燃烧着沙漠太阳之热的弯刀。这把弯刀在成功命中时造成{@damage 1d6}割伤伤害加上{@damage 1d6}火焰伤害。你可以使用你的法术属性调整值来进行弯刀的命中和伤害骰。如果你投掷1来命中，弯刀会破碎成千百片，你必须重新锻造一把新的。
如果你投掷自然20来命中，你可以选择粉碎弯刀。弯刀被摧毁，但碎片会埋入你的目标体内。你的目标必须进行一次体质豁免投骰。如果他们成功，他们会从身体里拔出碎片。如果失败，他们会在你的回合开始时受到{@damage 1d6}的割伤伤害。受害者可以在他们的回合结束时重复进行体质豁免投骰，成功豁免则结束伤害。碎片会继续钻入你的受害者，直到它死亡或成功豁免。

spell.name: Scattered Form
entries: 你的身体短暂地变形，分裂成一群昆虫来攻击附近的生物，然后立即重新形成。范围内的每个生物（除了你）必须进行一次敏捷豁免检定，失败则受到{@damage 2d10} 刺伤伤害，成功则减半。如果至少有一只生物未通过豁免检定，你将获得对非魔法钝击、刺击和斩击伤害的抗性，直到你的下一个回合结束。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用2级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，穿刺伤害会每个高于第一级别的法术位等级增加{@dice 1d10}。

spell.name: Scintillating Sphere

components.m: a small glass sphere and a pinch of iron oxide

entries: 一个小的带电球体出现在你面前的空气中，然后迅速飞向你能看到的范围内的一个位置。当球体到达该位置时，在一个20英尺半径范围内爆炸出电流。该区域内的每个生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免检定，否则会受到{@damage 5d10} 闪电伤害，豁免成功则减半。穿戴金属盔甲的生物在豁免检定时有劣势。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用4级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，伤害将每超过3级的位数增加{@dice 1d10}。

spell.name: Seal Mouth
entries: 选择范围内的一个生物。在咒语结束前，每当这个生物提到你，即使是间接提到，它必须进行一次感知豁免检定，如果它说的任何关于你的话被认为是批评性的、牵连性的或者以任何方式都是负面的。如果未通过检定，它的话会变成毫无意义的故事或者儿童童谣，其中无法辨认出任何相关意义。如果这个生物通过了感知豁免检定，那么咒语结束。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用4级或5级的法术位施放这个法术时，法术直到生物成功通过两次感知豁免才会结束。如果法术位是6级或更高级，法术直到生物成功通过三次感知豁免才会结束。

spell.name: Searing Light
entries: 一道光芒从你的手掌中射出。对射程内的目标进行远程法术攻击。如果命中，目标会受到{@damage 4d10}辐射伤害。如果目标是不死生物，它会受到最大伤害，并且必须进行一次感知豁免。未通过豁免检定的目标会在其下一个回合结束前处于{@condition stunned}状态。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用4级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，每超过3级的法术位级别，辐射伤害增加 {@dice 1d10}（或对不死生物的最大伤害）。

spell.name: Secret Page

components.m: powdered herring scales, and essence of will o' wisp

entries: 你可以将一页纸的内容完全转变成其他形式。比如把地图变成诗歌、商业账簿，甚至是一张空白页。《理解语言》法术无法揭示页面的真实内容。你可以使用一个口令来揭示页面的真实内容，或者连续说两次口令来结束法术。
该页面将散发出微弱的变化魔法光环。如果对该页面施放了驱散魔法，当使用2级或3级法术位施放此法术时，法术将终止，页面的真实内容将被揭示；然而，如果使用4级或更高级法术位施放此法术且驱散魔法失败，页面将被摧毁，其内容将无法恢复。
一种真实视觉法术将揭示页面的真实本质，但并不会让施法者获得解读文本所需的任何语言知识。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用高于2级的法术位施放这个法术时，你可以影响额外一页，并且解除其魔法的难度相应增加。

spell.name: See Hidden Doors
entries: 每分钟一次，在持续时间内，你可以透过特制的透镜搜索一段50英尺长的墙壁；当你透过透镜观察时，你会自动探测到你搜索的墙壁部分上隐藏的暗门的存在，因为它们周围会被微弱的光环环绕，只有在透过透镜观察时才能看到。

spell.name: See Through Other Eyes
entries: 选择范围内的一个目标。该目标必须进行一次感知豁免投。如果他们失败，你可以通过他们的眼睛看到事物。目标不知道你可以看到他们的视角。你可以使用一个奖励动作在你的目标的眼睛和你自己之间切换。你不会获得目标其他感官的访问权限，但只要你的目标保持在同一平面并且不进入一个反魔法领域，你可以在法术持续时间内通过他们的眼睛看到事物。如果目标成功豁免，法术无效。

spell.name: Seed of Fire
entries: 你的攻击在敌人的伤口中留下了一团闪烁的奥术能量。作为施放此法术所使用的动作的一部分，你必须使用武器进行一次近战攻击，针对法术范围内的一个生物，否则法术失败。命中后，目标遭受攻击的正常效果，你将其推开15英尺，将你的敌人从你的剑上踢开，然后它会爆发出一朵地狱般的火焰花。被你击中的目标和每个距离它10英尺内的生物必须通过一次敏捷豁免检定，否则会受到{@damage 4d6}火焰伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用5级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，火焰伤害将每个高于1级的法术位等级增加{@dice 1d6}。

spell.name: Seek Eternal Rest
entries: 在这个法术结束前，下次你使用一个能够使不死生物或其他生物胆战心惊的神圣能力选项时，你需要在转化效果的豁免投掷 DC 上额外增加 {@dice 1d4 + 1}，并且这个法术会结束。

spell.name: Seeking Missile

time.condition: which you take when you miss with a ranged weapon attack roll

entries: 你的抛射物在空中改变方向，击中你的敌人。你需要对同一目标重复触发的远程武器攻击检定。你必须使用新的检定结果。

spell.name: Seize Mind
entries: 用一个低语和一个锐利的凝视，你瞬间将一种冲动投射到敌人的心灵中，将其敌意转向你，使其突然对另一个敌人进行自发的攻击。选择一个你能看到的、也能看到和听到你的人形生物。目标必须成功通过一次感知豁免才能在其下一个回合开始前变为{@condition charmed}。如果一只生物当前不在战斗中，或者它目睹另一只生物在过去一分钟内未能通过对你施法的这个咒语的豁免，则该生物对这个豁免有优势。
当你用这个法术迷惑目标时，任何其他能看到或听到你的生物都会知道你已经在目标身上施加了魔法影响，你可以立即选择以下两种效果之一：

items: 你可以强迫{@condition charmed}目标向上移动最多15英尺，并且你可以选择它的移动方式。它不会进入复杂地形或穿过其他生物的空间，它的移动只会引发对你敌对的其他生物的机会攻击。在生物移动后，法术结束。
你可以对距离你{@condition charmed}目标5英尺内的另一个生物进行近战法术攻击。{@condition charmed}目标进行这次近战法术攻击，就好像它施放了这个法术一样。命中时，攻击造成{@damage 1d6}点精神伤害。无论攻击是否命中，法术都会结束。

entries: 当这个法术结束时，生物意识到你使用魔法控制它，并对你产生敌意。它可能会试图攻击你或你的盟友，但如果这样做对它或它的朋友不利的话，它可能不会这样做。根据情况，生物也可能以其他方式寻求报复（由DM决定）。
当你达到5级({@dice 2d6})、11级({@dice 3d6})和17级({@dice 4d6})时，该法术的伤害增加了{@dice 1d6}。

spell.name: Sensate's Rush
entries: 你将对新体验的渴望转化为一种特殊的心智专注状态。在持续时间内，每当你使用一种武器进行攻击，且该武器自上次摇骰子以来尚未使用过时，你需要投掷{@dice 1d6}，并将结果加到攻击骰中。当你施放需要攻击骰的法术，且该法术自上次摇骰子以来尚未施放过时，你也会获得相同的加值。

spell.name: Sensory Caress
entries: 在一个安静的反思时刻，你触摸一个生物，可以将它的痛苦或苦恼转移到自己身上，暂时抑制其一个困扰它的状态。该状态可以是{@condition blinded}，{@condition deafened}，{@condition paralyzed}，或{@condition poisoned}。当你抑制这个状态时，该生物不再受其困扰，但你立即自己承受相同的状态，持续一段时间，即使你通常对其免疫。在你的下一个回合结束时，你可以进行一次魔法豁免检定，检定 DC 为你自己的施法 DC。如果成功，该状态会提前结束，但对原生物仍然保持抑制，直到法术结束。如果失败，你可以在每个回合结束时再次进行豁免检定，直到你提前结束状态或法术结束。
当这个法术结束时，原本受到抑制的效果会恢复到最初遭受该效果的生物身上，前提是效果的持续时间在此期间没有结束。

spell.name: Sensory Deprivation
entries: 选择你能看到范围内的生物作为目标。该生物必须进行一次感知豁免。如果豁免失败，该生物将被{@condition blinded}，{@condition deafened}，并且在持续时间内无法受益于{@sense blindsight}或任何其他感官。
该生物可以在每个回合结束时尝试进行一次新的豁免投掷，若成功，则法术结束。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，你可以在范围内再影响一个生物，每超过4级的两个法术位级别。

spell.name: Sentinel's Mark
entries: 你选择一个在射程内可见的生物，并用这个更强大版本的猎人印记法术将其标记为你的(`hunter's mark`)注定猎物。直到法术结束，你在进行任何寻找目标或获取关于目标的其他信息的智力检定时都具有优势，并且每次用武器攻击命中目标时，你对目标造成额外{@damage 1d10}的伤害。
每当目标受到这个法术的额外伤害时，在其接下来的回合结束前，只要它在你的5英尺范围内，对不以你为目标的任何攻击骰都具有劣势。当一只生物被另一只生物标记时，它不会因此法术而遭受攻击骰的劣势。
如果目标在此法术结束前降至0点生命值，你可以在接下来的回合中使用一个奖励动作来标记一个新的生物。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用5级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，你可以将你的集中力保持在这个法术上，持续时间长达24小时。

spell.name: Serenity of Stone

m.text: a polished obsidian mirror worth 200 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: 你的身体和心灵被赋予了坚硬如石头和像流动岩浆一样不可阻挡的力量。直到法术结束，你获得对火焰伤害的抗性，以及对非魔法钝击、穿刺和挥砍伤害的抗性，并且在感知和智力豁免检定中获得优势。

spell.name: Serpent Arrows
entries: 你触摸了一个箭袋或弩箭筒。当用从箭袋中取出的弹药进行远程武器攻击击中目标时，目标会额外受到{@damage 2d6}毒素伤害。即使攻击未命中，目标也会受到{@damage 1d6}毒素伤害。当弹药击中或未命中时，法术的魔法效果就会结束，当从箭袋中取出十支弹药后，法术也会结束。
每次攻击后，无论命中与否，被使用的弹药都会掉落到离目标最近的一个空位，然后会变成一个巨大的有毒蛇，由使用弹药的生物控制。
这个法术创造的巨型毒蛇对你和你的同伴友好。它们在使用弹药的生物的回合结束后立即行动，但是它们有自己的行动顺序。这些蛇会听从控制它们的生物发出的任何口头命令（你不需要采取任何行动）。如果那个生物没有发布任何命令，这些蛇将继续攻击远程攻击的目标（即使目标已经降至0点生命值），但除此之外不会采取任何行动，只会进行自卫。
每条蛇在生命值降至0点或法术结束时都会变回一枚弹药。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用5级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，你可以影响的弹药数量每超过4级的法术位等级增加两个。

spell.name: Serpent Missile
entries: 能量之箭从你的手中跃出，击中你能看到的范围内的目标。目标必须进行一次体质豁免投。未通过检定的目标会受到{@damage 3d4}毒素伤害，并在其下一个回合结束前处于{@condition poisoned}状态。若通过检定，只受一半伤害且不会被{@condition poisoned}。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用2级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，你造成额外{@damage 1d4}的毒素伤害，且{@condition poisoned}状态持续时间每超过1级的位级增加一轮。

spell.name: Serten's Spell Immunity

components.m: the same material components, if any, as the spell you choose

entries: 选择一个4级或更低级别的法术。下次当你成为该法术的目标，或者包含在该法术的影响范围内时，该法术对你无效。一旦该法术被抵消，或者当你完成下一个长休后，该法术结束。

spell.name: Servant Army

components.m: a small stick crossbar to which many lengths of knotted thread are attached

entries: 你创造了{@condition invisible}个无意识、无形的力量，可以执行你命令的简单任务。掷{@dice 3d4}来决定你创造多少仆从。每个仆从会服从你发出的任何口头命令（无需你采取任何行动）。但是，如果你不发出任何命令，仆从会无所作为，等待你下一个命令。
一旦您下达命令，每个仆人都会尽其所能地完成任务，直到任务完成为止。然后等待您的下一个命令。您的仆人可以奔跑取物，打开卡住的门，扶着椅子，清洁和缝补。如果您仔细指导，仆人也可以用于一般费力的任务。仆人在任务上并不比一个基本的或无技能的普通人更优秀或更快。

仆人可以在宴会上端食物或酒，帮助挖掘土方，划船，充当搬运工，叠衣服，或者在农田里帮忙。每个仆人一次只能执行一项活动，但如果被告知继续执行同一项活动，它会持续重复。这使得你可以命令一个仆人执行重复的任务，然后在范围内转移你的注意力。仆人只能打开普通的门、抽屉、盖子等。它们的有效力量值为2（因此可以携带30磅重物，推、拉或举起60磅）。它们可以触发陷阱等，但只能施加60磅的力量，这不足以触发某些压力板和其他装置。仆人的速度为15英尺。
仆人不能以任何方式进行攻击，也永远不允许进行攻击骰。仆人的护甲等级为10，有6点生命值。仆人不能被杀死，但在受到6点伤害后会消散。（它们不进行豁免投掷）。如果你试图让一个仆人超出法术的范围（从你当前位置测量），那个仆人将消失。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，你会为每个高于5级的法术位级别创造{@dice 1d4}个额外仆从。当你使用7级或更高级别的法术位施放时，法术的持续时间增加至8小时。

spell.name: Shadow Burst
entries: 一团灰色阴影状的黏液从你的手中跃出，击中你能看到的范围内的一只生物，撕裂目标的眼睛，流入其口中，并以任何可能的方式威胁它。这团黏液弹对目标造成{@damage 2d6}点死灵伤害。
另外，目标必须进行一次体质豁免检定。如果未通过检定，目标在持续时间内对所有能力检定、攻击骰和豁免检定都有劣势。
目标可以在每个回合结束时尝试进行一次新的体质豁免投骰，成功则结束该法术。

spell.name: Shadow Form
entries: 你触碰的一个人被笼罩在暗影界的本质中。这个生物变得更难被看见，身体变得更加柔软。直到咒语结束，该生物在所有敏捷检定上获得优势({@skill Stealth})。每当进行此类检定时，它被视为精通{@skill Stealth}技能。已经精通{@skill Stealth}技能的生物在检定时，将其正常熟练加值翻倍，而不是正常的熟练加值。在咒语持续期间，这个咒语的目标还可以穿过任何大于1英寸宽的缝隙。

spell.name: Shadow Magic

components.m: an iron rod and a bit of bat fur

entries: 你施放了以下法术之一的幻象版本：火球（fireball）、寒冰锥（cone of cold）、或闪电箭（lightning bolt）。将其视为施法者施放了其中一个法术，但有以下例外：

items: 目标进行一次魅力豁免检定，而不是模仿法术的常规豁免检定。
在模仿法术的正常伤害之外，未能通过魅力豁免检定的生物会受到{@damage 4d6}点死灵伤害和{@damage 4d6}点精神伤害，通过检定则分别受到伤害的一半。
这个法术将生物的生命值降低到0点时，并不会被杀死，而是保持稳定，生命值保持在0点。受到这个法术伤害而倒下的生物可以在每个回合结束时进行一次感知豁免检定。若成功，它将恢复等同于这个法术造成的心灵伤害的生命值。
受到此法术精神伤害的生物，在受到伤害后1分钟会恢复相当于所受精神伤害的生命值，除非它通过对抗此法术的成功感知豁免已经恢复了这些生命值，如上所述。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级或更高级的法术位施放此法术时，你每超过4级的两个法术等级，额外造成{@damage 1d6}点心灵伤害。此外，当你使用7级或更高级的法术位施放此法术时，你每超过5级的两个法术等级，额外造成{@damage 1d6}点死灵伤害。

spell.name: Shadow Missile
entries: When you cast this spell, a wickedly bladed dart or throwing star made of black metal appears in your hand, and you hurl it instantly. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. You have advantage on this attack if you are lightly or heavily obscured from your target. The target is considered to have half cover against this attack if it is standing in direct sunlight (half cover grants +2 AC).

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} piercing damage. Hit or miss, the projectile breaks and explodes in a shower of shrapnel. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take one level of {@condition exhaustion} and {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. When a creature that already has one or more levels of {@condition exhaustion} gains a new level of {@condition exhaustion} from this spell, it becomes immune to gaining further levels of {@condition exhaustion} from this spell for 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level or higher spell slot, the necrotic damage increases by ld8 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shadow Monsters
entries: You select a shadowy area the size of a 40-foot cube within range. You cause four shadows (as described in the Monster Manual) to manifest in unoccupied spaces within the area. On each of your turns for the duration, you can use a bonus action to command the shadows to move up to their full speed and attack creatures of your choice within their reach.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 6th level spell slot, you summon 8 shadows. When you cast this spell with an 8th level spell sot, you summon 12 shadows.

spell.name: Shadow Sight
entries: An inner light flares in your eyes, allowing you to briefly see hidden things and gaze into even the deepest darkness. Until the end of your next turn, you can see normally in darkness, both magical and non-magical, to a distance of 60 feet. For the same duration, you see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

spell.name: Shadow Walk
entries: You and a creature you touch are transported to the border of the Shadowfell, where you can travel at a rate of 7 miles per hour and re-enter the Material plane at a location you know. Alternatively, you can choose to enter the Demiplane of Shadow and then travel to where it borders another plane of existence, and then exit at that location.

Instead of transporting a willing creature, you can make a melee spell attack as part of the same action used to cast this spell to touch an unwilling creature within your reach. On a hit, the creature is transported to the Demiplane of Shadow while you are transported to a space within 5 feet of it or to the border the material plane (your choice). If the creature doesn't find an exit to another plane before the spell ends, it is transported to a random plane that borders the Demiplane of Shadow.

spell.name: Shadowing Mark
entries: You choose a creature you can see within range and place an {@condition invisible} mark of shadow upon it. Until the spell ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom checks to find, notice, or discern information about you, and you have advantage on Wisdom checks to find, follow, or discern information about the target. Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll against the spell's current target during your turn. That attack deals an extra {@damage 1d12} psychic damage on a hit and scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
如果目标在此法术结束前降至0点生命值，你可以在接下来的回合中使用一个奖励动作来标记一个新的生物。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours, and you add your proficiency bonus to the psychic damage inflicted.

spell.name: Shard Storm

components.m: a crystal or piece of glass

entries: You fill a 20-foot radius sphere with ghostly shards of force and the sound of breaking glass. Anyone in the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} force damage, or half as much on a successful one. At the start of the creature's next turn, the shards continue to dig deeper, dealing half the damage they dealt the previous round. The shards disappear after the second round.

spell.name: Shield of Warding
entries: You touch a shield and imbue it with protective magic. The shield grants its bearer a +2 bonus to Armor Class and Dexterity saving throws for the spell's duration, in addition to the normal AC bonus for using a shield.

spell.name: Shieldbearer
entries: You touch a shield, and it hovers and moves to protect a target you choose within {@homebrew 10 feet|range}. For the duration, shield hovers within the chosen creature's space and provides it with the same bonus to Armor Class it would grant if the creature were using it proficienctly. Once the shield's recipient has been chosen, it cannot be changed for the duration of the spell.

If the creature you choose to protect with this spell moves more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends early. When the spell ends, the floating shield falls gently to the ground at the chosen area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th Level, you can maintain your Concentration on the spell for up to 10 minutes. When you use a spell slot of 5th Level or higher, you can maintain your Concentration on the spell for up to 1 hour.

spell.name: Shielding Cube

components.m: A cube of wax covered in arcane runes

entries: You direct a minute cube of force into the thick of battle, where it suddenly expands, slamming your enemy and protecting your allies. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature within range. If the attack hits, the target takes {@damage 2d6} force damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of its next turn. Until its speed is longer reduced in this way, whenever the target takes makes an attack against a creature more than 5 feet away from it, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用2级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，伤害将每个高于1级的位级增加{@dice 1d6}。

spell.name: Shift Glyph
entries: All magical glyphs and symbols within range faintly glow and can be safely read and identified if you are familiar with them. In addition, you can select one of the glyphs or symbols and move it safely to another suitable surface within range without triggering its effects.

This spell prevents the spellcaster from triggering glyphs and symbols within range while maintaining {@status concentration} but doesn't extend this protection to other creatures that may trigger them.

spell.name: Shifting Paths
entries: {@homebrew {@note Converter's note: In the source material, what type of material the material component requires is unknown.}}

This spell hides a path or road that you choose, while also creating an illusory path that starts at a point you choose within range. The illusory path continues in a direction you choose for up to a number of miles equal to 2 × your spellcasting ability modifier. This illusory path avoids obstacles, and does not provide bridges, stairs, ladders, ramps, or other methods to travel through impassable terrain. The path will not cross cliffs or rivers more than four feet deep.

A creature following the original path must make a Wisdom saving throw when it comes to the start of the illusory path. On a failed save, the creature follows the illusory path as if it were the real one. If the path moves through difficult terrain, the creature believes the path slopes and twists to justify its reduction in speed.
On a successful save, the creature sees both paths, but the illusory path appears shadowy.

spell.name: Shifting Shadow
entries: Too quickly for mortal eyes to perceive, you move no further than the reach of your shadow. You can move up to 5 feet, and this movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

spell.name: Shockwave

components.m: A small sphere of carved crystal

entries: When you cast this spell—created as an alternative to fireball for battles on crowded streets—you create a burst of concussive force that disorients victims without causing permanent harm. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 7d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you can choose to knock the creature {@condition unconscious} instead of killing it. This choice must be made as damage is assigned if the creature drops to 0 hit points. A creature knocked {@condition unconscious} by the spell is stabilized at 0 hit points, as if by the spare the dying cantrip.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shout of Undeath

components.m: dust or bone fragments from any destroyed undead creature

entries: You shroud yourself in necrotic energy, temporarily gaining the traits of undeath. Your appearance does not change except for a very slight pallor, but your creature type changes to undead for the duration of the spell.

Nonintelligent undead creatures perceive you as one of their kind, ignoring you. Intelligent undead do not immediately recognize you as alive, but may question whether you are undead. Any ability check made to determine that you are not truly undead is made with disadvantage, and you have advantage on all Charisma checks to convince others of your undead nature.

If an undead creature does target you directly with an attack or a harmful spell, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (an undead needn't make the save when it includes you in an area effect, such as the explosion or fireball). On a failed saving throw, the creature must choose a new target or forfeit targeting someone else, potentially wasting the attack or spell. A creature automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it has made a successful saving throw against this effect within the last 24 hours or it has seen you target an undead creature with an attack or other harmful effect within the last 24 hours.

Because you are undead, if a spell or other effect states that it does not affect undead, then it does not affect you for the spell's duration. Conversely, effects that do affect undead (such as the Turn Undead class feature) affect you as such.

spell.name: Shooting Stars

components.m: a wax candle lit and held for the duration

entries: Three fiery orbs appear and hover above you for the duration. As part of the action used to cast the spell, you can launch all the motes at targets you can see within range. However, a target can attempt a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the fiery motes. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage, and the mote detonates. The target and each creature within 10-feet of the burst must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes {@damage 5d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful one. Targets within 45 feet of the caster have disadvantage on the initial saving throw.

If a target makes the initial Dexterity saving throw, the mote misses and flies to the extent of the spell's range and then bursts with the same effects described above. The caster can fire all the motes the first round or use an action to fire the remaining motes before the duration expires.

spell.name: Shout of Deafening Thunder
entries: {@homebrew {@note Converter's note: This spell can be found on the spell lists as simply 'Shout' in the source material.}}

You let out a thunderous shout that blasts outward from you in a 30-foot cone. A creature caught in the blast must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} thunder damage and be {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area. The sound of the shout can be heard up to 500 feet away (or farther with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check as determined by your DM).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Sign of Sealing

m.text: a crushed emerald worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You seal a door, chest, book, or other object that can be closed with a magical sigil that bars entry and prevents opening. The protected object can only be opened if broken, or with knock or dispel magic. However, if the object is forced open by any means (physical or magical), the sigil explodes in 30-foot radius for {@damage 10d4} force damage. A successful Dexterity saving throw halves the damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the amount of force damage increases by {@dice 1d4} per slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sign of Warning

components.m: a pinch of dried tea leaves

entries: You burn prophetic herbs, and the billowing smoke grants visions of future danger, giving one creature you touch preternatural foresight in battle. The next time the creature makes a Dexterity check for initiative before the spell ends, it treats any roll of 9 or lower on the {@dice d20} as a 10. In addition, for the duration, when the target fails a Wisdom check, if that failure would cause it to be surprised, it can reroll that ability check. It must use the second roll.
The spell ends early on a target whenever that creature makes an ability check for initiative.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can touch and affect one extra creature for every two spell levels above 1st.

spell.name: Silent Portal
entries: For the duration, while you are within range, the selected door, chest, gate, or other object with a maximum volume of 10 cubic feet does not make any noise when it is opened or closed.

spell.name: Simbul's Spell Sequencer

m.text: pieces of amber worth a total of 5,000 gp, which are consumed in the casting of this spell

entries: You use several pieces of ancient amber to create a matrix that contains spells you cast, frozen in time until you need them. While casting this spell you cast up to three spells of 1st through 3rd level, and you choose a command word. When the command word is spoken, all three spells take effect immediately, in the order they were cast, as if you had just cast all three of them in the same turn, and the spell ends. At the time they are unleashed, you make all decisions for each of these spells (targets, area, etc.) that you would normally make as the caster. You may only have one Simbul's spell sequencer active at a time.

Only spells with a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action can be cast into your spell sequencer. When you create the sequencer, you reduce your maximum Hit Dice by a number equal to the total combined levels of the spell slots used to cast the spells you place in it. Your maximum number of Hit Dice does not return to normal until the spell ends. If the duration expires and you did not speak the command word, or if you choose to dismiss the spell, the spell ends, and the other spells you cast into your sequencer are lost.

spell.name: Sinsabur's Baleful Bolt
entries: You hold out your hand and unleash a wave of dark energy that rots your victims. Every creature within a 50 foot line must make a Constitution saving throw. They take {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw and half as much on a successful one. The creature's hit point maximum is also reduced by the amount of damage taken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can cast this spell using a 5th level or higher spell slot. You inflict plus {@damage 1d6} damage for each spell level above 4th.

spell.name: Sinuous Horrors
entries: Your arms transform into snakes when you cast this spell. On each of your turns, you can make two melee spell attacks with the snakes, with a reach of 10 feet. On a hit, a target takes poison damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. In addition, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.

You cannot cast spells with somatic or material components while this spell is active, and holding things will be difficult at best. This spell cannot be dismissed (though it can be dispelled). It lasts a full minute regardless of the caster's wishes.

spell.name: Skip Time
entries: If you have already willingly moved this turn, this spell fails. You shunt away some time from the current moment, stealing it from yourself now to grant yourself an extra opportunity to act in the future. Once you cast this spell, your speed is halved until the end of this turn. After the end of this turn, you gain the following benefits, which last until the end of your next turn:

items: Your speed is doubled.
You gain a +2 bonus to AC.
You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

You gain an additional action during your turn. That action can be used only to take one of the following actions: {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, Disengage, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object}.

entries: Each time you cast this spell, if you have previously cast it one or more times within the past minute, you suffer 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Skulking Spy

time.condition: which you take when you would make a Dexterity check for initiative

entries: At the moment hostilities begin, you can immediately seek to evade your foes' notice. As part of the reaction used to cast this spell, you can move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks, before initiative is resolved. If you have any cover or concealment at the end of this movement, you can take the {@action Hide} action as part of the same reaction, and you can even attempt to hide from creatures who saw you move.

spell.name: Slaying Arrow
entries: You charge an arrow or bolt with energy that is an anathema to a creature. Choose one creature type while casting, and while casting you can fire the arrow or bolt, or give it to an ally to fire on their turn. If the arrow or bolt hits, and the creature struck is the creature type named during the spell casting, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If the creature has more than 50 hit points they automatically make this save. If they fail they are slain. If they pass the arrow does {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage in addition to its regular damage. This extra damage ignores resistance and immunity.

spell.name: Sleep of Horror
entries: A target you choose within range must make an Intelligence saving throw. If it fails the save, its next sleep is wracked with terrifying nightmares, and does not gain any of the benefits of a long rest. After that, every time it finishes a long rest, it must make the Intelligence saving throw again. If it fails, it gains no benefit from the long rest. If it succeeds, the spell ends. The spell continues until the target makes its Intelligence saving throw, or until it dies.

spell.name: Sleeper Awakens
entries: A corona of white psychic energy emanates from your head and eyes as you enter a combat trance that allows you to anticipate your enemy's actions. For the duration, no attack against you can benefit from advantage, opportunity attacks are made against you with disadvantage, and you gain advantage on Wisdom checks to discern information about creatures that are not friendly to you. In addition, until the spell ends, whenever an attack roll is made against you or a friendly creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

spell.name: Slime Wave

components.m: a few drops of stagnant pond water

entries: A 20-foot radius area you can see within range is covered in green slime (see "Dungeon Hazards" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). Each creature in the area is also covered in a patch of green slime. A creature moving through the area must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw for every 5 feet travelled to avoid being covered in a patch of green slime.

You can use an action to cause the area of slime to move in a wave up to 10 feet in a direction you choose. Any creatures in the area of the wave are covered in a patch of green slime. Any creature that was previously covered by the slime, but no longer in its area, must still deal with the green slime as normal.

spell.name: Snilloc's Snowball
entries: You conjure a small sphere of freezing energy which you can hurl at your enemies. Make a ranged spell attack. If you hit you inflict {@dice 1d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier cold damage. For the duration, you can use your action to summon and hurl another sphere of freezing energy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can cast this spell using a 2nd level or higher spell slot, and you inflict plus {@damage 1d6} damage for every spell level above 1st.

spell.name: Snow Boots
entries: You create pockets of air around your legs and feet, which allow you to hover slightly above snowy surfaces. For the duration, moving through difficult terrain made of ice or snow doesn't cost you extra movement and you don't risk slipping.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can touch and effect one extra creature for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Snow Snakes

components.m: three drops of water in the palm of your hand

entries: Choose an area of snow within range. The area transforms into 3 giant constrictor snakes. As part of the action used to cast the spell and by using your action on subsequent turns, you can direct the snakes to move and attack creatures within their reach. When a snake hits a target with its attack, the creature takes an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you create one extra giant constrictor snake for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Song of Battle
entries: You play a musical instrument and recite a valorous song that bolsters nearby allies. All allies that start their turns within the spell's radius have advantage on Wisdom saving throws and are immune to being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} for the duration.

spell.name: Sorcerous Scribe
entries: You summon a magical quill that writes down anything you say. The quill can write on any surface. The quill will not scribe magic spells, but any command words you would use to activate some kind of magical effect can be recorded. The quill continues writing and does not run out of ink for the duration.

spell.name: Soul Scour

components.m: a pinch of dust from the bones of a lich

entries: Your touch corrupts your victim's very soul, damaging some of its mental characteristics. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and has disadvantage on Wisdom checks, Wisdom saving throws, Charisma checks, and Charisma saving throws. At the end of the target's next turn, it must make an Intelligence saving throw. If it succeeds, the spell ends. If it fails, it may make another Intelligence saving throw 1 minute later. If it succeeds, the spell ends. If it fails, the spells effects last for the duration.

This spell can also be ended with greater restoration, heal, or wish. However, the caster of a greater restoration or heal spell must choose to affect either the Wisdom or Charisma of the target of this spell. Only the effects of this spell on ability checks and saving throws for the selected ability are affected. Thus, it requires two castings of greater restoration or heal (or one of each) to remove all the effects of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级或更高级别的法术位施放这个法术时，每超过5级的位级，心灵伤害增加{@dice 1d6}。

spell.name: Sow Confusion
entries: Creatures around you find their attention drawn elsewhere, allowing you to slip away. Until the end of the turn, all Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to perceive you are made at disadvantage. In addition, each creature of your choice that you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw. Non-hostile creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw, but creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} automatically succeed.

If even one creature fails the save, you can immediately move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks. You can move through the spaces of hostile creatures during this movement as if they were friendly. If you have any cover or concealment at the end of this movement, you can take the {@action Hide} action as part of the same bonus action used to cast this spell, with this {@action Hide} action allowing you to attempt to hide from creatures who saw you move.

spell.name: Spark of Life
entries: You imbue an undead target with a sliver of life, making it vulnerable to conditions that usually affect the living. When you cast this spell, you make a melee spell attack against an undead target. On a hit, the undead creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or lose all of its condition immunities. The target also loses its damage resistances, and its damage immunities become resistances instead.
After the spell expires, the target knows what you have done, and will likely have a hostile attitude toward you.

spell.name: Speechlink
entries: You touch one willing ally. You and this ally can communicate verbally no matter how much distance is between you, as long as you are on the same plane. You will hear what your ally chooses to tell you, no matter the volume, and vice versa. You do not hear any other sounds from your ally's location. This spell works on any creature with an Intelligence of 3 or greater, but does not bestow any ability to comprehend an unknown language. You or the ally can end the spell at any time.

spell.name: Speed of Thought
entries: You marshal psychic energies to move with speed and acrobatic grace. When you cast this spell, you gain two speed points. For the duration, as a bonus action on your turn, you can expend a speed point, granting yourself all of the following benefits until the end of that turn:

items: 你的速度增加了10英尺。
You have resistance to falling damage.
Difficult terrain does not reduce your speed.
You have a climb speed equal to your walking speed.
Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
You add 10 feet to your long jump distance and 3 feet to your high jump distance.
You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) and Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks.
You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.
You do not sink when moving over soft or brittle terrain, such as dust, silt, mud, snow, or thin ice. This effect does not allow you to move over liquid surfaces.
If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that attack inflicts an additional {@damage 1d4} damage.

entries: At the end of the turn, the benefits fade entirely until you spend another speed point. If these benefits end while you are still on a vertical surface, or anywhere else where you would normally fall or sink, you immediately fall or begin to sink unless you have some other means to remain there.
This spell ends when its duration expires, when you cast this spell again, or when you have spent all your speed points. When the spell ends, any unspent speed points are lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage you inflict with melee weapon attacks against opponents when you move 20 feet increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st. In addition, if you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you gain one additional speed point for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Spell Engine

m.text: a disc of polished bone, one of your tears, and a silver wheel worth 500 gp

entries: When you cast this spell, a light appears above you that provides illumination in a 30-foot radius. While studying your spellbook under this light, you may swap out any of the spells you have prepared, trading each spell you choose to swap out for a new one of the same level. Normally, preparing each new spell takes 1 minute per level of that spell, but while this spell is active, the preparation time is halved.
This spell does not refresh any spent spell slots.

spell.name: Spell Resistance
entries: The creature you touch has advantage on saving throws against spells, and has resistance to damage from spells for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can touch and affect one extra creature for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Sphere of Adaptation
entries: You anoint a creature with holy water, and a 20-foot radius sphere of air surrounds it, allowing creatures inside it to breathe in any environment. The sphere moves with the anointed creature for the duration. The sphere does not protect those inside it from extremes of heat and cold, or other environmental hazards.

spell.name: Sphere of Ultimate Destruction

components.m: a pinch of dust from a disintegrated creature

entries: You conjure a 5-foot diameter featureless black sphere of nothingness that disintegrates almost anything it touches. The sphere appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration.

Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 12d6 + 60} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated, as if by the disintegrate spell. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

As an action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. When you move the sphere, it flies, and you can move it any direction you wish. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage. If you ram the sphere into a Medium or smaller object that is not being held or carried, that object is disintegrated. If you ram this sphere into a Huge or larger object, it disintegrates the 5-foot cube area of that object it strikes. If you ram the sphere into a creation of magical force (such as the wall created by a wall of force spell), it has the same effect on that magical force that it would have on an object of the same size. Magic items are not affected by this spell.

Whenever you ram the sphere into a creature or object, it uses up 10 feet of movement for every 5 feet it moves through the space occupied by that creature or object. No object or creature can be affected by the sphere more than once in the same turn.

spell.name: Sphere of Wonder

m.text: a diamond sphere worth at least 10,000gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You throw the diamond sphere into the air and it explodes into multicolored light. The light hangs in the air above you and follows your movement. The light emits bright light out to 30 feet and dim light for 30 feet beyond.

When you cast the spell you choose one damage type. Anyone, including you that casts a spell using a different damage type within the light must make a Wisdom saving throw. If they succeed the spell works as normal. If they fail the spell is countered. The spell has no effect on a spell that was cast out of the light. The light automatically dispels magical and natural darkness within 60 feet on you.

spell.name: Spider Gout
entries: You spit a glob of congealed spider venom at your foe. Make a ranged spell attack. If you hit your foe takes {@damage 2d4} poison damage. The spider venom is sticky, and your foe must make a Strength saving throw at the end of their next turn. If they fail they take {@damage 2d4} poison damage. If they succeed, they scrape the sticky poison off and the spell ends. Your foe must repeat a Strength saving throw at the end of their turn, taking damage if they fail, and ending the spell with a success.

spell.name: Spider Plague
entries: You summon four otherworldly aberrations that appear as giant spiders in unoccupied spaces you can see within range (your DM has statistics for giant spiders). The spiders are friendly to you and aid you to the best of their abilities. The spiders have their own initiative and act on their own turns for the duration. The spiders obey your commands without you having to spend an action; if you don't issue a command, the spiders defend themselves if they are threatened.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, you summon two extra spiders.

spell.name: Spidersilk Slash

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You spin your blade impossibly fast, creating silvery strands of silk that bind nearby enemies. Choose up to five creatures you can see within range. Make a melee spell attack against every creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 5d8} force damage and until the start of your next turn, its speed is reduced to zero and it cannot benefit from any bonus to its speed.

spell.name: Spirit Annihilation

m.text: a piece of onyx worth at least 500 gp

entries: Choose a target within range that is at 0 hit points. That target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be slain. There spirit is trapped in the onyx, and they cannot be resurrected until the onyx is destroyed. The onyx van only hold one soul at a time.

spell.name: Spirit Mask

components.m: a mask made of vines and thorns

entries: You don the mask, linking it to a random faerie spirit. Anyone attempting to target you or include within the area of effect of a divination spell must make an Intelligence saving throw. If they fail the divination spell show images of the faerie spirit. Faerie spirit will know its being observed and most are intelligent enough to figure out why. Most faeries will be curious, and a few will be openly hostile toward you and the caster of the divination spell. If the mask is destroyed before the spell duration expires, the spell ends.

spell.name: Spirit of Flame
entries: You step into a fire and are immediately teleported to another fire within range. Both fires must be the size of a large campfire, a torch or even a small fireplace will not be large enough. The caster must have an idea of where the fire is and what its surrounding are like. If there is no suitable fire within range, then the spell fails, and the caster takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

spell.name: Spirits of Victory
entries: You unleash a howling host of warrior spirits who died before they could defeat their foes, and for the duration they assault your enemies while helping you and your allies achieve victory. If you are good or neutral, their spectral forms resemble angels or ephemeral constructs (your choice). If you are evil, they appear to be undead. Until the end of your next turn, when a creature willingly leaves a space within 5 feet of you or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d12} psychic damage and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage but suffers no other effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the psychic damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Spiteful Glamour
entries: For a moment, you cause the mere sight of you to be painful to an enemy. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} psychic damage. If the target is not missing any of its hit points, it instead takes {@damage 1d12} psychic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Spy's Recovery

time.condition: which you take when you roll a Dexterity, Wisdom, or Charisma check and you dislike the result

entries: You can reroll the ability check that triggered this spell. You roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to your result. You must use the new roll, even if it is lower.

spell.name: Stalwart Pact

m.text: incense worth 250 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@homebrew {@note Converter's note: The duration of this spell is "Up to 8 hours until triggered, and then 1 minute".}}

You touch a creature and grant it protection for the next 8 hours. The first time the creature's hit points drop below half its hit point maximum, it gains 25 temporary hit points, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage, and a +1 bonus to saving throws for 1 minute. Once the effect is triggered and the duration expires, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you gain an additional 5 temporary hit points and an extra +1 to saving throws for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Static Shock
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage and it is charged with crackling arcane energy until the spell ends. If the target makes an attack roll before the end of its next turn, it takes force damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If the attack hits, the damage the attack inflicts is reduced by an amount equal to the force damage dealt by this spell. Either way, the spell ends after the attack is resolved.

At 5th level, the lightning damage from the ranged spell attack increases by {@dice 1d4}, and the force damage dealt to a target who attacks equals {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damages increase by {@dice 1d4} at 11th and 17th level.

spell.name: Steal Speed
entries: You slow an opponent while making yourself faster. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. Until the start of your next turn, you add a number of feet to your own speed equal to the number of feet by which you reduced the target's speed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}). In addition, the speed you steal increases by 5 feet as well when you reach 5th level (15 feet), 11th level (20 feet), and 17th level (25 feet).

spell.name: Step of a Dozen Paces
entries: You must not yet have moved this turn, otherwise the spell fails. Stepping through {@condition invisible} folds in the borders between planes, you teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see, and your speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, your speed after teleporting is halved instead of being reduced to 0, and the distance you can teleport is increased by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sticks to Snakes
entries: You turn a hand full of sticks into {@dice 1d4 + 1} constrictor snakes (your DM has their statistics). The snakes you create with this spell are friendly to you and your companions. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. Once the spell ends, the snakes turn back into sticks.

If another creature is holding sticks that you wish to transform, if that creature does not wish the sticks to be affected by this spell, you must make a melee spell attack as part of the action of casting this spell. If the attack misses, the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, you transmute the sticks into giant constrictor snakes. If you cast the spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you transmute one extra stick into a giant constrictor snake for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Stolen Breath
entries: Choose one target within range. That target must succeed on a Constitution save or spectral claws reach into its chest and rip the air out of its lungs. On a failure, it immediately begins choking (per the rules in Chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook), and until the spell ends it cannot take reactions, and it can only take either 1 action or 1 bonus action on each of its turns. During this time, it cannot move unless it takes an action that allows it to move (such as the {@action Dash} action).
The target can end these effects by using its action to catch its breath. Once it does so, it is no longer choking, and the spell ends.

spell.name: Stone Body

components.m: a small piece of stone from a stone golem

entries: For the duration, your body is turned into living stone. You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from all sources except adamantine weapons. You are immune to poison damage, disease, and drowning, and to the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition poisoned}, and {@condition stunned} conditions.
However, you also suffer disadvantage on all {@dice d20} rolls that include your Dexterity modifier. Your speed is cut in half, and you weigh three times more than normal.

spell.name: Stone Spiders
entries: You cast this spell on three small stone pebbles in range, no two of which can be more than 30 feet apart. The pebbles grow and turn into constructs that look like stone spiders. The constructs can grow up to huge in size. However, all the constructs must be the same size. The constructs you create with this spell are friendly to you and your companions. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. Each stone spider has the same statistics as a giant spider, with the following exceptions.

items: Its natural Armor Class increases by 6.
It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons and immunity to poison and psychic damage.
Its poison save DC is equal to your spellcasting DC.

spell.name: Stone Tell
entries: You grant an area of stone with a maximum size of 20 cubic feet the ability to speak to you for the duration. You can ask the stone questions, and it will provide answers to the best of its ability. The stone can tell you what creatures have recently passed nearby or have touched it, or what lies beyond. However, the stone communicates with a primordial intelligence, so you might not receive the answers you'd expect.

spell.name: Stone Walk

m.text: crushed gems worth at least 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell links any two buildings made of stone that can be any distance apart but are both on the same plane of existence. Each temple area must have a stone platform large enough for one creature to stand upon, which is used as a teleportation pad. Before the spell is cast, each platform must be prepared by crushing 2,000 gold pieces worth of gemstones and performing a 10-minute ritual.

To complete the spell, you must perform another 10-minute ritual using the remaining 1,000 gold pieces worth of crushed gemstones. During the final ritual, a command word is chosen that will be used to travel back and forth between the teleportation pads. When the command word is spoken, one person may be transported with up to 100 pounds of gear.

Teleportation using this spell is infallible and cannot be blocked by magical barriers or wards against teleportation. If the destination pad is blocked by solid matter, the traveller is sent to an unoccupied space nearby.

spell.name: Stony Grasp

components.m: a miniature hand sculpted from stone

entries: This spell functions like Maximillian's earthen grasp except the hand is made of stone, and it deals {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage on both the initial grab and the crushing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Storm Cone
entries: When casting this spell, you point in a direction and emit a 60-foot cone shaped whirling vortex. As an action on each of your turns, you can change the direction of the cone up, down, or sideways by 10 feet.

The vortex whirls around any creature caught in its area, blasting it with fist-sized balls of force, and jolting it with small lightning strikes. The creature takes {@damage 5d4} bludgeoning damage from the wind buffets, and {@damage 2d4} lightning damage. A successful Dexterity saving throw halves the bludgeoning damage, but not the lightning damage.

In addition, a spellcaster caught in the cone must make a successful Constitution saving throw when casting a spell with somatic components. Though it is against your normal spellcasting DC, this saving throw is the equivalent of a roll to maintain {@status concentration} on a spell, and special benefits or other effects the creatures has on such Constitution saving throws apply.

spell.name: Storm of Elemental Fury
entries: A furious storm erupts in a 40-foot radius, 100-foothigh cylinder centered on a point you choose within range. When you cast this spell, and again at the beginning of each of your turns until the spell ends, the storm produces one of the following effects, starting with the first, and then progressing down the list.

entries.name: 1st Turn
entries: The storm buffets the area with a raging windstorm. No creature within the area can make ranged attacks or be the target of a ranged attack. A Small or smaller creature caught in the storm's area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is swept up, thrown {@dice 2d6 × 10} feet in a random direction, and takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage per ten feet thrown. A Medium creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. A Large or larger creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or its speed drops to 0.

A Large flying creature that fails its saving throw is blown {@dice 1d6 × 5} feet in a random direction, Medium f lying creatures are blown {@dice 1d6 × 10} feet, and Small flying creatures are blown {@dice 2d6 × 10} feet away.

For the spell's duration, any creature must make a Constitution saving throw the first time it tries to cast a spell inside the area. If it fails, it cannot cast spells within the area until the spell ends. A creature that failed its saving throw can make another Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns. If it succeeds, it can cast spells normally again.

entries.name: 2nd Turn
entries: Rocks fall from the sky, pummelling creatures caught in the storm's area. Each creature caught in the area takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage (no save).

entries.name: 3rd Turn
entries: Heavy rain pours into the area, automatically extinguishing unprotected flames, and extinguishing protected flames 50% of the time. Visibility within the area is reduced to 5 feet, and the entire area of the spell becomes difficult terrain.

entries.name: 4th Turn
entries: Gouts of flame rain down from the sky into the storm's area. Any creature caught within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 14d6} fire damage, or half as much if successful.

spell.name: Storm Shield
entries: You conjure a small area of whirling air that occupies a 5-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The swirling air forms a shield that blocks acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage. The shield attracts all elemental discharges and neutralizes them, granting all creatures within a 30-foot radius from its center immunity to the listed damage types. However, the shield's immunity is limited. If the shield reduces damage a creature would take to 0, the spell ends if it is not the first time that the shield has reduced damage that particular creature would have taken to 0 since this spell was cast.

spell.name: Storm Tower
entries: A 20-foot radius by 100-foot high tower of storm winds surrounds you. The swirling winds nullify any lightning effects that contact the barrier. In addition, ranged attacks through the barrier are impossible. A creature that tries to pass through the barrier must succeed on a Strength saving throw; otherwise it takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage from the high winds, and it makes no progress. A creature can make more than one attempt to cross the barrier on its turn, but it receives one level of {@condition exhaustion} for each unsuccessful attempt beyond the first.
Once the storm tower appears, it is stationary for the duration, but you can move normally inside it.

spell.name: Stormrage
entries: You gain a flying speed of 40 feet, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage inflicted by ranged attacks. You are also immune to the effects of all wind or weather-based spells and attacks (such as control weather).

In addition, as an action on each of your turns for the duration, you can emit a single bolt of lightning from your eyes as a ranged spell attack against a target within 100 feet. You have advantage on the attack if the target you select is wearing metal armor. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} lightning damage.

spell.name: Strength of One
entries: Choose a number of willing targets equal to your spellcasting ability modifier that you can see within range. You may choose yourself as one of the targets. For the duration, every target has the Strength statistic of the target with the highest Strength.

spell.name: Strength of Stone
entries: The strength of elemental earth and stone infuse your body. You gain advantage on all {@dice d20} rolls that include your Strength modifier, and when you make an attack roll that gains advantage from this spell, that attack inflicts an extra {@damage 1d8} damage if it hits. This spell ends if you leave the ground at any time. The walls and ceiling count as ground if you can walk along either surface.

spell.name: Succor

m.text: a platinum ring with a diamond worth at least 10,000gp

entries: You enchant a ring and choose a command word. When the creature wearing the ring repeats the command word, it is instantly teleported to the nearest empty space to you. This spell fails if the creature wearing the ring is not on the same plane as you. Only one creature can be teleported by the ring, but anything it is carrying comes with it.

spell.name: Sudden Transformation
entries: You bark a few seemingly simple commands, but they are imbued with the majesty of past warlords. Choose up to seven creatures you can see within range that can hear you when you cast this spell. After you choose these creatures, you can immediately move up to half your speed. Once you end this movement, each creatures you chose can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. A creature which moves in this way must end its movement within 5 feet of you.

spell.name: Sudden Stalagmite
entries: A ten-foot tall, very sharp stalagmite erupts under your target, who must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} piercing damage, and is {@condition restrained} as the stalagmite pierces its flesh. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, but is not {@condition restrained}, and the spell ends. A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell cannot escape until it uses an action to free itself by making a successful Strength saving throw, or until another creature within 5 feet of it succeeds on a Strength check against your spellcasting DC. When the target is freed, it takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage, and the spell ends. If the target has not escaped when the spell ends, the target is freed.

spell.name: Sudden Transposition
entries: With a single word of magical power, you cause two creatures to swap places. Choose two Small or Medium creatures that you can see within range. You can only choose two creatures which are either standing on the same surface or standing on surfaces which are physically connected by solid ground or structures. A creature which is unwilling to be transposed gains a Charisma saving throw against this effect. If neither creature makes a successful saving throw, both creatures are teleported, with each reappearing in the space previously occupied by the other.

spell.name: Suffer the Flesh
entries: You can sacrifice your own flesh to power your spells. For the duration, for every 10 hit points you channel into the spell the spell is cast as if it one level higher. For example, while this spell is in effect, you cast a fireball as a 3rd level spell, you could channel 10 hit points to cast fireball as a 4th level spell, 20 hit points to cast is as a 5th level spell, etc. Channeling hit points into a spell lowers both your current hit point total and your hit point maximum. Your hit point maximum returns to normal after a long rest.

spell.name: Summons of Justice
entries: Sacrificing some of your own vitality, you emit holy energy that compels your enemies to come forward. You hurl two rays, which can be aimed at one target or split between more. For each ray, make one ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage, and you can pull it up to 15 feet closer to you.
You also take 2 points of radiant damage for each ray that hit, which cannot be reduced by any means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Summons of Khirad
entries: {@homebrew {@note Converter's note: This spell is not found in the spell lists, only within the spell descriptions and the index. As such, to which classes' spell list it belongs is unknown}}

You shoot a bolt of blue flame at your enemy, who shimmers for a second before teleporting to a place of your choosing. Make a ranged spell check. On a hit, you deal {@damage 5d6} psychic damage to the target and it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you can teleport it to any empty space you can see within 30 feet of it where it would be on solid ground that can support its weight. Once the target is teleported, it immediately provokes opportunity attacks from all creatures within 5 feet of it.

spell.name: Sunbolt
entries: A blinding flash of light leaps from your hand to a target. Choose one target within range, that target must make a Dexterity saving throw. They take {@damage 8d8} radiant damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. Undead are particularly vulnerable to this spell, making the save with disadvantage. Undead that are weak to sunlight (vampires, for example) are {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn if they fail the Dexterity saving throw.

spell.name: Sundered Bravery
entries: Your empowered strike hurls your foe to the ground, hobbles it with panic, and causes it to flinch with terror at every nearby movement. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 7d12} psychic damage and falls {@condition prone}. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, if they fail the target is {@condition frightened} of you, and its speed is halved until the start of your next round. Undead, constructs, and creatures immune to being {@condition frightened} aren't affected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Sunscorch
entries: A sun-like 10-foot diameter sphere of light appears, centered on a point you can see within range that is at least 20 feet above you. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the sun could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can't accommodate the required height).

When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see within range, which is stuck by a blinding ray of light from the false sun. Make a ranged spell attack, ignoring cover. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage. If the target is undead, roll d8s for this damage instead of d6s. A target that takes this damage must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.
The false sun vanishes at the end of the turn, but until then it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, increasing the damage by {@dice 1d6} ({@dice 1d8} against undead) for each spell level above 1st.

spell.name: Sunstone
entries: You channel elemental heat from the Plane of Fire into a stone. The stone glows red hot, but you can handle it without any ill effect. For the duration, the stone emits bright light for 15 feet and dim light for 15 feet beyond that.
